result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles D. Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DNA sample previously submitted.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Deft to serve 2-1/2yrs confinement plus 5-1/2yrs extended supervision for a total of 8yrs bifurcated sentence.  kmk

Defendant's sentence shall be modified as follows:
The total bifurcated sentence is eight years consisting of two and one-half years of initial prison confinement and five and one-half years of extended supervision, with sentence credit and all other conditions to remain as initially ordered.  JOC to be amended.  (cc: DA, atty)

Defendant Charles D. Parks appeared with Attorney Scott  Szabrowicz.  Defendant in custody @ New Lisbon.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: JM.
MINUTES:  Arguments heard on the motion.  Court grants def's postconviction motion for relief and amends the sentence to 2 1/2 years IC & 5 1/2 years ES, with the orig. sentence credit.  JOC to be amended after def. atty files the order granting his motion.
from Atty Scott Szabrowicz
Dated 12/10/15 - IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding  the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to January 15, 2016.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Defendant Charles D. Parks appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Def. currently on federal prob.
Sentence:
ITC is:   5 years, forthwith
ES  is:   3 years
TLS is:  8 years
112 days sentence credit given.  Conditions of extended supervision given.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Defendant is eligible for the SAP program but not CIP.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  DNA sample and surcharge previously submitted.  Appeal rights given.
from Michelle Sullivan
from Defendant

Defendant Charles D. Parks appeared with Attorney David E Celebre.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Fel-Man/Del Heroin-PTAC-2nd, Repeater (enhancer dropped); found guilty by the court.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles D. Parks appeared with Attorney David E Celebre.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, discovery issues, needs more time.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
